item.title: The 4 biggest AI stories from 2024 and one key prediction for 2025
item.description: By all measures, 2024 was the biggest year for artificial intelligence yet — at least when it comes to the commercialization.

item.title: The code whisperer: How Anthropic’s Claude is changing the game for software developers
item.description: The software development world is experiencing its biggest transformation since the advent of open-source coding. Artificial intelligence assistants, ...

item.title: Unintended consequences: U.S. election results herald reckless AI development
item.description: AI accelerationists have won as a consequence of the election, potentially sidelining those advocating for a more cautious approach.

item.title: Large language overkill: How SLMs can beat their bigger, resource-intensive cousins
item.description: Whether a company begins with a proof-of-concept or live deployment, they should start small, test often and build on early successes.

item.title: Arm lawsuit against Qualcomm ends in mistrial and favorable ruling for Qualcomm
item.description: Qualcomm did not violate a license with Arm when it acquired Nuvia for $1.4 billion, in a ruling by a jury today.
